chapter.title: Creating a Simple JSF Application
chapter.para: Firstly, we assume that you have already launched Eclipse with JBoss Tools plug-ins installed and also that the Web Development perspective is the current one. (If not, make it active by selecting WindowOpen PerspectiveWeb Development from the menu bar or by selecting WindowOpen PerspectiveOther... from the menu bar and then selecting Web Development from the Select Perspective dialog box.)

section.title: Setting Up the Project
section.para: Now we are going to create a new project for the application.

listitem.para: For that go to the menu bar and select FileNewProject...
Select JBoss Tools WebJSFJSF Project in the New Project dialog box.
Enter jsfHello as the project name.
Leave everything else as is, and click the Finish button.

section.title: JSF Configuration File
section.para: A jsfHello node should appear in the upper-left Package Explorer view.

listitem.para: Click the plus sign next to jsfHello to reveal the child nodes
Click the plus sign next to WebContent under jsfHello
Click the plus sign next to WEB-INF under WebContent
Then double-click on the faces-config.xml node to display the JSF application configuration file editor
